intro: Sempervivum aureggi, commonly known as the golden hens and chicks, is a species of sedum native to the Pyrenees region of Europe. It is a low-growing, mat-forming plant with fleshy, rosette-shaped leaves that are typically green with a striking golden or orange hue. The plant produces showy, star-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, or white during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Sempervivum aureggi is drought-tolerant and hardy, capable of surviving in a wide range of climates.
